perturbation.original_text: LICENSOR shall make a first delivery of Content to plan_b within 14 days after the signing of this Agreement unless separately agreed between the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: LICENSOR shall make a first delivery of Content to plan_b within 30 days after the signing of this Agreement unless separately agreed between the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: Many jurisdictions require businesses to fulfill contractual obligations promptly. Lengthening the delivery timeframe to 30 days could be seen as unreasonable and contradicts implied duties of good faith and fair dealing in contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: plan_b shall provide LICENSOR with a detailed written record, which includes the number of End User downloads and each distribution channel. Such report shall be provided to LICENSOR in electronic format within 6 weeks of the end of a quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: plan_b shall provide LICENSOR with a detailed written record, which includes the number of End User downloads and each distribution channel. Such report shall be provided to LICENSOR in electronic format within 16 weeks of the end of a quarter.
perturbation.explanation: Increasing the reporting timeframe to 16 weeks following the end of each quarter could be viewed as an unreasonable delay in providing crucial financial information, potentially contradicting the duty of good faith and fair dealing implied in the contract, as timely reporting is vital for revenue calculations and business decisions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: The Initial Term shall automatically be extended for an additional period of half a year unless either party provides the other party with written notification of termination of the letter Agreement at least 60 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.changed_text: The Initial Term shall automatically be extended for an additional period of half a year unless either party provides the other party with written notification of termination of the letter Agreement at least 15 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification period for termination to 15 days prior to the end of the term could be considered commercially unreasonable. Contract law implies a reasonable notice period, and such a short timeframe may not allow the other party sufficient time to make alternative arrangements, thus contradicting standard commercial practice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
